author: Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures (ASCDC), Taiwan (R.O.C.)

resources.description: The ASCDC Sparql endpoint (http://data.ascdc.tw/sparql) is a platform aggregating all LOD-based datasets established by the ASCDC. It is structured as a mechanism for semantic query anything one wishes or specific theme-based contents in the datasets so users can easily understand the semantic data model of the target data. The Sparql endpoint also provides query examples as user indication and the retrieved results can be downloaded in JSON, XML, TTL and CSV file formats.
resources.name: SPARQL Endpoint

resources.description: The TaiUC-Biology-fish is a LOD-based dataset designed to structure the digitized items of fish species in semantic data model, which are collected in the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=17509) and maintained by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures in Taiwan. Containing 40,972 data records and 1,216,545 triples, the dataset can be downloaded in N-triple format. In the dataset, the descriptive metadata is released under CC 0, while the digitized resources, including images, videos, etc., are licensed after regulations given by the original data provider.
resources.name: TaiUC-Biology-Academia Sinica_fish

resources.description: The TaiUC-Anthropology-Cultural Heritages of Taiwanese Indigenous People is a LOD-based dataset to preserve the digitized items of cultural heritages and handicraft works produced by the Taiwanese indigenous people in the semantic data model, which are derived from the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=38973). With its 3,767 data records and 107,248 triples, the dataset, which is maintained by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures (ASCDC) in Taiwan, can be downloaded in N-triple format. The descriptive part of the metadata in the dataset is released under CC 0.
resources.name: TaiUC-Anthropology-Cultural Heritages of Taiwanese Indigenous People

resources.description: The LOD-based dataset of the TaiUC Art Textbooks is created based on the original metadata of “the Archive of the Art Textbooks of Elementary and Public Schools in the Japanese Colonial Period”, which is collected in the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=55514) and maintained by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures in Taiwan. The data content is focused on the information of digitized pictures and texts published in the aforesaid Archive. Containing 1,849 data records and 60,906 triples, the dataset can be downloaded in N-triple format.
resources.name: TaiUC-Art-Archive of the Art Textbooks of Elementary and Public Schools in the Japanese Colonial Period

resources.description: The LOD-based dataset of the TaiUC-Media-CTS programs is created based on the original metadata from “the Chinese Television System (CTS) Educational and Cultural Programs Digital Archive”, which is collected in the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=61756) and maintained by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures in Taiwan. The data content is focused on the information of five television programs produced by CTS, such as “Nature Classroom”, “One Word a Day”, “Voices of the Hokkien”, “Harvest Season” and “Hometown Yearnings”, and digitized video clips of these TV programs. Containing 726 data records and 33,128 triples, the dataset can be downloaded in N-triple format.
resources.name: TaiUC-Media-The Chinese Television System Educational and Cultural Programs Digital Archive

resources.description: This LOD-based dataset of the TaiUC-Religion-Tibetan audio collection is created based on the metadata from “the Tibetan Collection Audio Archive”, which is collected in the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=38949) and maintained by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures in Taiwan. The data content includes the information and digitized sound recordings of the Buddhist texts chanting and preaching by the Tibetian monks. Containing 1,305 data records and 114,590 triples, the dataset can be downloaded in N-triple format.
resources.name: TaiUC-Religion-The Tibetan Collection Audio Archive Research Project

resources.description: The TaiUC-Biology-National Museum of Marine Biology and Aquarium is a LOD-based dataset designed to structure the digitized items of fish species in semantic data model, which are collected in the Taiwan digital archives Union Catalogue (TaiUC, http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=57275; http://catalog.digitalarchives.tw/Organization/List.jsp?CID=4892) and maintained by the National Museum of Marine Biology and Aquarium in Taiwan. Containing 9,115 data records and 265,342 triples, the dataset can be downloaded in N-triple format. In the dataset, the descriptive metadata is released under CC 0, while the digitized resources, including images, videos, etc., are licensed after regulations given by the original data provider.
resources.name: TaiUC-Biology-National Museum of Marine Biology and Aquarium

organization.description: Established in 2013, the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures (ASCDC, http://ascdc.sinica.edu.tw/en/index.jsp) is responsible for planning and implementing core digital archives projects at Academia Sinica (main project), while also coordinating and managing the work of digital archives expansion and digital technology development done by various institutes and centers at Academia Sinica (sub-projects). The Center also supports and cooperates with the National Science Council’s "The Sustainable Management of Taiwan Digital Archives Project". Academia Sinica’s institutes and centers have been engaged in a long-term endeavor to apply information technology to the archiving of precious cultural heritage, historical documents, archaeological discoveries, biological specimens, and a wide variety of photographic images stored at Academia Sinica, as well as developing related digital information and web technology. These efforts have resulted in the accumulation of over a million digital collections and the construction of nearly one hundred websites and databases, all of which represents immense potential for future development and utilization.
organization.title: Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures
organization.name: ascdc

name: ascdc
notes: The ASCDC-TaiUC LOD is a platform to collect the LOD datasets, which are converted from the original Taiwan Union Catalog and provided by the Academia Sinica Center for Digital Cultures (ASCDC) in Taiwan. All open and published ASCDC LOD datasets gathered inside can be freely reused and downloaded by everyone.
title: ASCDC_TaiUC LOD
